Package org.neo4j.adversaries.pagecache

Class AdversarialReadPageCursor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.io.pagecache.PageCursor
      • org.neo4j.io.pagecache.impl.DelegatingPageCursor
        • org.neo4j.adversaries.pagecache.AdversarialReadPageCursor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    class AdversarialReadPageCursor
extends DelegatingPageCursor
    A read page cursor that wraps another page cursor and an adversary to provide a misbehaving page cursor implementation for testing.

    Depending on the adversary each read operation can throw either RuntimeException like SecurityException or IOException like NoSuchFileException.

    Depending on the adversary each read operation can produce an inconsistent read and require caller to retry using while loop with PageCursor.shouldRetry() as a condition.

    Inconsistent reads are injected by first having a retry-round (the set of operations on the cursor up until the shouldRetry() call) that counts the number of operations performed on the cursor, and otherwise delegates the read operations to the real page cursor without corrupting them. Then the shouldRetry will choose a random operation, and from that point on in the next retry-round, all read operations will return random data. The shouldRetry method returns true for "yes, you should retry" and the round with the actual read inconsistencies begins. After that round, the client will be told to retry again, and in this third round there will be no inconsistencies, and there will be no need to retry unless the real page cursor says so.

    Write operations will always throw an IllegalStateException because this is a read cursor. See PagedFile.PF_SHARED_READ_LOCK flag.

      • rewind

        public void rewind()
        Description copied from class: PageCursor
        Rewinds the cursor to its initial condition, as if freshly returned from an equivalent io() call. In other words, the next call to next() will move the cursor to the starting page that was specified in the io() that produced the cursor.
        Overrides:
        rewind in class DelegatingPageCursor

      • next

        public boolean next()
             throws IOException
        Description copied from class: PageCursor
        Moves the cursor to the next page, if any, and returns true when it is ready to be processed. Returns false if there are no more pages to be processed. For instance, if the cursor was requested with PF_NO_GROW and the page most recently processed was the last page in the file.

        NOTE: When using read locks, read operations can be inconsistent and may return completely random data. The data returned from a read-locked page cursor should not be interpreted until after PageCursor.shouldRetry() has returned false. Not interpreting the data also implies that you cannot throw exceptions from data validation errors until after PageCursor.shouldRetry() has told you that your read was consistent.

        Overrides:
        next in class DelegatingPageCursor
        Throws:
        IOException

      • next

        public boolean next​(long pageId)
             throws IOException
        Description copied from class: PageCursor
        Moves the cursor to the page specified by the given pageId, if any, and returns true when it is ready to be processed. Returns false if for instance, the cursor was requested with PF_NO_GROW and the page most recently processed was the last page in the file.

        NOTE: When using read locks, read operations can be inconsistent and may return completely random data. The data returned from a read-locked page cursor should not be interpreted until after PageCursor.shouldRetry() has returned false. Not interpreting the data also implies that you cannot throw exceptions from data validation errors until after PageCursor.shouldRetry() has told you that your read was consistent.

        Overrides:
        next in class DelegatingPageCursor
        Throws:
        IOException

        public void close()

        Relinquishes all resources associated with this cursor, including the cursor itself, and any linked cursors opened through it. The cursor cannot be used after this call.
        Specified by:

        close in class DelegatingPageCursor
        See Also:

      • shouldRetry

        public boolean shouldRetry()
                    throws IOException
        Description copied from class: PageCursor
        Returns true if the page has entered an inconsistent state since the last call to next() or shouldRetry().

        If this method returns true, the in-page offset of the cursor will be reset to zero.

        Note that write locked cursors never conflict with each other, nor with eviction, and thus technically don't require a shouldRetry check. This method always returns false for write-locking cursors.

        Cursors that are read locked must always perform their reads in a shouldRetry loop, and avoid interpreting the data they read until shouldRetry has confirmed that the reads were consistent.

        Overrides:
        shouldRetry in class DelegatingPageCursor
        Throws:
        IOException - If the page was evicted while doing IO, the cursor will have to do a page fault to get the page back. This may throw an IOException.

      • resetDelegate

        private void resetDelegate()
                    throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • copyTo

        public int copyTo​(int sourceOffset,
                  PageCursor targetCursor,
                  int targetOffset,
                  int lengthInBytes)
        Description copied from class: PageCursor
        Copy the specified number of bytes from the given offset of this page, to the given offset of the target page.

        If the length reaches beyond the end of either cursor, then only as many bytes as are available in this cursor, or can fit in the target cursor, are actually copied.

        Note that copyTo is only guaranteed to work when both target and source cursor are from the same page cache implementation. Using wrappers, delegates or mixing cursor implementations may produce unspecified errors.

        Overrides:
        copyTo in class DelegatingPageCursor
        Parameters:
        sourceOffset - The offset into this page to copy from.
        targetCursor - The cursor the data will be copied to.
        targetOffset - The offset into the target cursor to copy to.
        lengthInBytes - The number of bytes to copy.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes actually copied.

      • checkAndClearBoundsFlag

        public boolean checkAndClearBoundsFlag()
        Description copied from class: PageCursor
        Discern whether an out-of-bounds access has occurred since the last call to PageCursor.next() or PageCursor.next(long), or since the last call to PageCursor.shouldRetry() that returned true, or since the last call to this method.
        Overrides:
        checkAndClearBoundsFlag in class DelegatingPageCursor
        Returns:
        true if an access was out of bounds, or the PageCursor.raiseOutOfBounds() method has been called.

      • setCursorException

        public void setCursorException​(String message)
        Description copied from class: PageCursor
        Set an error condition on the cursor with the given message.

        This will make calls to PageCursor.checkAndClearCursorException() throw a CursorException with the given message, unless the error has gotten cleared by a PageCursor.shouldRetry() call that returned true, a call to PageCursor.next() or PageCursor.next(long), or the cursor is closed.

        Overrides:
        setCursorException in class DelegatingPageCursor
        Parameters:
        message - The message of the CursorException that PageCursor.checkAndClearCursorException() will throw.

      • clearCursorException

        public void clearCursorException()
        Description copied from class: PageCursor
        Unconditionally clear any error condition that has been set on this or any linked cursor, without throwing an exception.
        Overrides:
        clearCursorException in class DelegatingPageCursor

      • openLinkedCursor

        public PageCursor openLinkedCursor​(long pageId)
                            throws IOException
        Description copied from class: PageCursor
        Open a new page cursor with the same pf_flags as this cursor, as if calling the PagedFile.io(long, int, org.neo4j.io.pagecache.tracing.cursor.PageCursorTracer) on the relevant paged file. This cursor will then also delegate to the linked cursor when checking PageCursor.shouldRetry() and PageCursor.checkAndClearBoundsFlag().

        Opening a linked cursor on a cursor that already has a linked cursor, will close the older linked cursor. Closing a cursor also closes any linked cursor.

        Overrides:
        openLinkedCursor in class DelegatingPageCursor
        Parameters:
        pageId - The page id that the linked cursor will be placed at after its first call to PageCursor.next().
        Returns:
        A cursor that is linked with this cursor.
        Throws:
        IOException
